author: Rahi Gaikwad
text:
The Mumbai police have registered a case of sexual harassment against a senior Royal Bank of Scotland executive for allegedly harassing a female colleague by sending her inappropriate messages. The FIR against Jai Jingar, Country Executive (India), RBS, was filed by a senior employee, police said.

They added that an offence under IPC sections 354A (sexual harassment) and 509 (word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman) and under provisions of the The Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 has been registered. This Act now supersedes the Vishaka Guidelines for sexual harassment at workplaces, set by the Supreme Court. According to the police, Jingar has allegedly been sending inappropriate text and WhatsApp messages with sexual overtones to the complainant over the past one-and-a-half years. They said a notice has been issued to him and the matter is under investigation.

Despite several attempts by The Hindu to reach Jingar via email, he remained unavailable for comment.

Police register FIR against Royal Bank of Scotland’s country executive for India after senior colleague alleges prolonged harassment over SMS, WhatsApp
title: Banker booked for sexual harassment
